HELP.TITLE: How does this work?
HELP.DESCRIPTION:
Keep track of all trips you made. For the first time create a new route and then add trips.

Import the routes using the wizard from OpenStreetMap or use bikerouter.de.
HELP.WELCOME_DESCRIPTION: OVDB is a tool for tracking, visualizing, and analyzing all your journeys. Whether you travel by train, bus, tram, metro, or ferry - OVDB helps you create maps of your travels, track statistics, and share your travel experiences.
HELP.GETTING_STARTED_STEP1:
Step 1: Set up route types
Before adding routes, create route types in the Data ‚Üí Types section. Define categories like 'Train', 'Bus' and 'Tram' with colors to organize and visualize your different transport modes.
HELP.GETTING_STARTED_STEP2:
Step 2: Add your first route
Use the wizard to search for public transport routes from OpenStreetMap, or upload your own GPX/KML files. Each route represents a specific line or path you have travelled.
HELP.GETTING_STARTED_STEP3:
Step 3: Track your trips
For every time you travel a route, add a Trip with the date and any extra details like departure times or special properties.
HELP.GETTING_STARTED_STEP4:
Step 4: Explore and share
View your journeys on maps with filters on time and location, generate statistics and create sharing links to show your travels.
HELP.MAPS_DESCRIPTION: Your maps show your routes as colourful lines on a map. Click on routes to see details, filter on date ranges, route types and regions, and see your travel network grow over time.
HELP.ROUTES_DESCRIPTION: Routes represent the paths you travel - train lines, bus routes, walking paths, or that cable car. Import them using the wizard that connects to OpenStreetMap data, or upload your own GPS tracks in GPX or KML format.
HELP.TRIPS_DESCRIPTION: Every time you travel a route, create a trip. Add departure and arrival times, special properties like vehicle numbers or your seat, and assign trips to multiple maps for flexible groupings.
HELP.FILTERING_DESCRIPTION: Filter your maps on date ranges, route types, or countries. Use preset filters like 'this month' or 'this year', or use custom date ranges to focus on specific periods of your travel history.
HELP.STATISTICS_DESCRIPTION: Analyse your travel patterns with detailed statistics. See distance travelled per day, month, or year. View which transport operators you use most and which regions you have explored.
HELP.STATION_MAPS_DESCRIPTION: Explore special station maps showing all stations in specific regions. Check off stations you have visited or use the Telegram bot integration (@ovdb_bot) to mark stations on the go by sharing your location.
HELP.SHARING_DESCRIPTION: Create public sharing links for your maps so others can explore your travel adventures. Each map can have its own unique sharing URL.
HELP.TRAEWELLING_DESCRIPTION: Connect your Tr√§welling account to easily import your check-ins as trips. This makes it easy to keep your OVDB data up to date with your real journeys.
HELP.TELEGRAM_DESCRIPTION: Use the @ovdb_bot on Telegram to check off stations while you travel. Simply share your location with the bot to find nearby stations and mark them as visited.
HELP.IMPORT_WIZARD_DESCRIPTION: The wizard connects to OpenStreetMap data to help you find and import routes. Search by line name or network to find the routes you have travelled.
HELP.FILE_UPLOAD_DESCRIPTION: Upload GPS tracks in GPX or KML format. Perfect for walking routes, cycling paths, or any custom journey not available in OpenStreetMap. For easy drawing of GPX/KML files you can use bikerouter.de.
HELP.EXPORT_DESCRIPTION: Export your routes and statistics in GPX format. Keep your data portable and create backups of your travel history.
HELP.TIP1: Organize with multiple maps: Create separate maps for different journeys - easy to find that one holiday.
HELP.TIP2: Use route types: Classify your routes by transport type (train, bus, tram, etc.) to create colour-coded visualisations.
HELP.TIP3: Add trip details: Add departure/arrival times and custom properties to build a database of your travel experiences.
HELP.TIP4: Regular updates: Keep your data current by regularly importing new trips. The Tr√§welling integration makes this easier.
HELP.TIP5: Explore statistics: Check your statistics regularly to discover interesting patterns in your travel behaviour.
HELP.SUPPORT_DESCRIPTION: Need help or suggestions? Use (if you are logged in) the 'Requests' button in the menu bar or visit the GitHub repository to report issues, request features, or contribute to the project. OVDB is open source.
HELP.START_EXPLORING: Ready to begin? Go to the data section and create your first routes.
HELP.BUSSES: Buses (pay attention at roundabouts) (this one could probably be neater):
HELP.POST_SCRIPTUM: This help page was mainly written by AI. I just didn't fancy doing it myself and it works quite well.

HOME.EXPLANATION: Add your routes using the Data button or add types or countries. View your own maps with the buttons below and create links to share them online.
HOME.CREATELINKTOSHARE: Create a sharing link name to be able to share
HOME.INFONOTLOGGEDIN: To watch someone's map you need their personal link. Do you have an account? Log in below
HOME.NOMAPS: You don't seem to have any maps. Create a map!
LOGIN.TITLE: Log in
LOGIN.UPINCORRECT: Email or password incorrect, try again!
REGISTER.TITLE: Create your account
ADDROUTE.TRAEWELLING_INFO: Upload a GPX or KML file with your route data. The timing and metadata from your Tr√§welling trip will be applied to the route after creation.
IMPORTER.TRAEWELLING_INFO: Creating a new route from your Tr√§welling trip. You can search for OSM data or upload a GPX file.
EDITMULTIPLE.TITLE: Edit multiple routes
EDITMULTIPLE.UPDATEDATE: Update the date for selected routes
EDITMULTIPLE.UPDATETYPE: Update the type for selected routes
EDITMULTIPLE.UPDATECOUNTRIES: Update the countries for selected routes
EDITMULTIPLE.UPDATEMAPS: Update the maps for selected routes
ROUTEINSTANCESEDIT.TITLE: Edit trip
MAPINSTANCES.TITLE: Trips
FILTER.EXPLAINDATES: Chosen dates take precedence over selected years
MAPOPTIONS.TITLE: Filter options
IMAGES.DESCRIPTION: Here you can generate a dynamic image of the distances you have covered this year on your maps. Choose the maps you want to show, choose a title and select the dimensions of the image. You can also include totals if you want. At the bottom you can find a preview and the link you can use to embed the image. Images are generated at most every 15 minutes
IMAGES.TITLE: Title
NAME: Name
STATIONMAP.TITLE: Update stations map
STATIONMAP.DESCRIPTION: Here you can create stations maps. These are maps showing all stations in a certain region. You can then tick off the stations. If you are missing a certain region please create an issue on GitHub.
FILTER.LIMITTOSELECTEDAREAS: Cut routes to selected areas. Attention: this will take longer.
UPDATE.TITLE: Dark mode
UPDATE.DESCRIPTION: A bit less bright on your screen, toggle via the menu. On the profile page, there are new blocks for a telegram bot to check off stations. In addition, there is also a Tr√§welling connection to make it easier to import your check-ins. Also, new statistics about the regions you've visited and which train companies you've used.
UPDATE.NEW_COUNTRY_OR_REGION: Request new country, regions or companies
REQUESTS.NEW_REQUEST_PLACEHOLDER: Could you add Iceland? Could you split Italy into its provinces, e.g. Lomdardy and Tuscany?

PROFILE.TITLE: User profile
PROFILE.TELEGRAM_EXPLANATION: You can mark stations you visited on the go using the Telegram bot. Share your location with @ovdb_bot to find nearby stations and toggle your visit status.
PROFILE.PASSWORD_MIN_LENGTH: Password must be at least 10 characters long
PROFILE.TRAEWELLING_EXPLANATION: Connect your Tr√§welling account to automatically import your transit check-ins as route instances in OVDB.

TRAEWELLING.TITLE: Tr√§welling connection
TRAEWELLING.NO_ROUTE_INSTANCES_FOUND: No matching trips found for this date
TRAEWELLING.TRIP_LINKED: Trip successfully linked to existing trip
TRAEWELLING.NO_UNIMPORTED_TRIPS_MESSAGE: All your recent Tr√§welling trips have been imported or ignored. Check back later for new trips!
TRAEWELLING.ADD_TO_ROUTE: Add new trip to existing route
